intro: Galium pseudoasprellum, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses seeds through wind and animals. Galium pseudoasprellum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
